headline.main: Getting Patients to Think About Costs

docs.abstract: When it came to their own treatment, patients did not want cost to play a role in decision-making, according to a new study in Health Affairs.
docs.snippet: When it came to their own treatment, patients did not want cost to play a role in decision-making, according to a new study in Health Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Washington has changed the way it plans to reimburse New York State for the care of people with developmental disabilities.

headline.seo: $500 Million Chasm Opens in Proposed State Budget
headline.main: $500 Million Chasm Opens in Proposed State Budget
headline.print_headline: $500 Million Chasm Opens in Proposed State Budget

docs.abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's proposed state budget has $500 million hole because of changes in how Washington plans to reimburse state for care of people with developmental disabilities; to offset shortfall, Cuomo will propose that state cut $120 million from budget of Office for People with Development Disabilities, and $380 million from Medicaid programs.
docs.snippet: Washington has changed the way it plans to reimburse New York State for the care of people with developmental disabilities.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said the rule would let millions gain access to treatment for mental illnesses and other conditions, but some worry about the lack of a national uniform standard of care.

headline.seo: New Federal Rule Requires Insurers to Offer Mental Health Coverage
headline.main: New Federal Rule Requires Insurers to Offer Mental Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: New Federal Rule Requires Insurers to Offer Mental Health Coverage

docs.abstract: Obama administration issue final rule defining 'essential health benefits' that must be offered by most health insurance plans in 2014, and says that 32 million people will gain access to coverage of mental health care as result.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said the rule would let millions gain access to treatment for mental illnesses and other conditions, but some worry about the lack of a national uniform standard of care.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida, a leading critic of President Obama’s health care law, said he now backed a three-year expansion of coverage for poor people.

headline.main: In Reversal, Florida to Take Health Law’s Medicaid Expansion
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Florida Says It Will Expand Medicaid

docs.abstract: Florida's Republican Gov Rick Scott, vocal critic of Pres Obama’s health care law, reverses course and says he now backs three-year expansion of state's Medicaid coverage for poor people.
docs.snippet: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida, a leading critic of President Obama’s health care law, said he now backed a three-year expansion of coverage for poor people.

byline.contributor: Michael Cooper contributed reporting from New York.

docs.abstract: One of the crowning achievements of the civil rights movement is hanging by a thread as the Supreme Court prepares to take up a challenge to the Voting Rights Act.
docs.snippet: One of the crowning achievements of the civil rights movement is hanging by a thread as the Supreme Court prepares to take up a challenge to the Voting Rights Act.

headline.main: Health Care Aside, Fewer Jobs Than in 2000

docs.abstract: Without employment in the health care sector, which has added more jobs than any other sector, the United States would have fewer jobs than it did in 2000.
docs.snippet: Without employment in the health care sector, which has added more jobs than any other sector, the United States would have fewer jobs than it did in 2000.

docs.abstract: The employer penalties under the Affordable Care Act may have the effect of reducing wages, particularly because the penalties are not tax-deductible.
docs.snippet: The employer penalties under the Affordable Care Act may have the effect of reducing wages, particularly because the penalties are not tax-deductible.

docs.lead_paragraph: I lost my leg because of a preventable mistake.

headline.main: Losing My Leg to a Medical Error
headline.print_headline: Losing My Leg to a Medical Error

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Frederick S Southwick describes his experience losing his leg due to medical error, saying he is just one of estimated million patients seriously injured by preventable mistakes each year; calls for better communication and coordination among health care providers to ensure future patients do not suffer same life-changing harm.
docs.snippet: I lost my leg because of a preventable mistake.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court ruling that strengthened the power of the Federal Trade Commission could limit the ability of public hospital authorities to claim immunity from federal antitrust laws.

headline.main: Supreme Court Gives F.T.C. a Win on Hospital Mergers
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Gives F.T.C. A Win on Hospital Mergers

docs.abstract: Supreme Court ruling strengthens power of Federal Trade Commission to block hospital mergers, issuing opinion that could limit ability of public hospital authorities to claim immunity from federal antitrust laws; decision restores authority of FTC to challenge merger of only two hospitals in Albany, Ga.
docs.snippet: A Supreme Court ruling that strengthened the power of the Federal Trade Commission could limit the ability of public hospital authorities to claim immunity from federal antitrust laws.
